Crushers aren't known for their curiosity, or really anything other than very efficiently crushing things, which on the off chance they pay a visit to a Laser Drill, it's best we all know you're up to the task of taking one down.

Good hunting, Prospector!

Main-Osiris-Questline-Trust.name: Dangerous Science
Main-Osiris-Questline-Trust.description:
Osiris came to Fortuna III to investigate the alien ruins, largely thought to be terraformers by an ancient civilization known as "Progenitors".

Helping them may unlock the secrets of the planet's deadly storms and its exotic radiation. Or at least, it'll unlock access to more advanced Osiris gear and medical items.

Main-ICA-Questline-Gruntwork.name: Doing the Work
Main-ICA-Questline-Gruntwork.description:
Thousands of people live on Prospect Station without any concept of what it takes to keep the lights on. The ICA needs brave prospectors risking it all to operate on the planet, so they can keep things running in orbit.

There's evidence one such prospector got stranded on the surface, now it's up to you to help track them down. Despite all the violence and rivalry, nobody deserves to be left alone on Fortuna III.

Main-Osiris-Questline-LaserPrototype.description:
Dr. Fedotov wasn't impressed with the attempt at using explosives to break into the Crystal Cavern. His solution: a laser.

At least he agrees with Dr. Sullivan on the importance of getting through the cavern's walls, even if they don't see eye to eye on much else.
Main-Osiris-Questline-LaserPrototype.name: Laser Show

Main-Osiris-Questline-CrystalSamples.name: Everything is Crystals
Main-Osiris-Questline-CrystalSamples.description:
The new laser cannon is a beast more suited as a military weapon than a mining tool, and requires far more power than any laser drill on Prospect Station has access to.

Make sure Osiris gets what it needs to get it working.

Main-Osiris-Questline-ExplosivesTry.name: Explosive Delivery
Main-Osiris-Questline-ExplosivesTry.description:
The caverns you found are encased by a crystalline structure, far too strong for any of your weapons to break through. Sullivan believes there's a connection between them and the Progenitor terraforming tech.

Explosives aren't the usual Osiris way, but they're a time-tested cheap way of opening holes in walls.

Main-Osiris-Questline-GruntWork.name: Field Research
Main-Osiris-Questline-GruntWork.description: You've met up to Sullivan's standards, a feat few manage. Now that you've proven yourself capable, he might send you to investigate some of the planet's old mysteries.

Main-KOR-LetiumRumors-5.shortDescription: Find or purchase an ICA Data Drive and slot it into an Uplink Station to upgrade it to the specified Rarity.
Main-KOR-LetiumRumors-5.name: Messenger Service
Main-KOR-LetiumRumors-5.description: Our team still can't get out, but their research can. Find an Uplink station, your credentials should get us the data they've stored in the surface network.

Main-KOR-Questline-FocusCrystals.description:
Focus Crystals are a staple in many new electronics, particularly those built in the Fortuna system.

It would be nice if some of those electronics could help with locating them, and with the right materials the techs at Korolev might have just the thing.
Main-KOR-Questline-FocusCrystals.name: Focused on Crystals

Main-Osiris-Questline-StormSamples.description:
Fortuna III's storms are infamous, being one of the first signs of the lethal events that would force the evacuation of the planet.

The creatures of Fortuna III, however, seem energized by them, literally. Help Osiris understand what's going on.
Main-Osiris-Questline-StormSamples.name: Storm Rider

Main-KOR-Questline-Caverns.description:
Fortuna III's surface was riddled with active mining and research sites before the storms hit, but the planet's new exotic radiation field leaves only a scarce few accessible today. One of particular interest, Tharis Island, has recently been deemed safe to explore. Well, safe from the radiation and the worst of the storms, at least.

Vadim wants you to explore the old Korolev mining operation there; for some reason his predecessor became obsessed with the the twisting caverns that make up the island's central feature, but the records are scarce and full of holes. Perhaps he found something precious, a secret treasure to deliver a clear edge over the competition?
Main-KOR-Questline-Caverns.name: In a Deep Dark Hole

Main-Osiris-Questline-SideWork1.description:
Getting Dr. Fedotov out of cryo may have been more trouble than its worth. After a (justified) tirade against Dr. Sullivan for not rescuing him sooner, he's refusing to speak to anyone in person until a series of curious demands are met.

It'll be best to keep him content, if only for his new assistant's sake.
Main-Osiris-Questline-SideWork1.name: The Needs of the One

Main-Osiris-Questline-UplinkHack.description:
Getting what is basically a an orbital beam cannon into an orbit around Fortuna III isn't as easy as it first seemed.

Help Osiris ensure their new satellite gets operational, and make sure the other factions don't catch wind about what's going on; whatever is past those cavern walls, only Osiris could fully understand.
Main-Osiris-Questline-UplinkHack.name: Satellite Master

Main-KOR-Questline-Gruntwork.name: Good, Honest Work
Main-KOR-Questline-Gruntwork.description:
Now that you're part of the Korolev family, it's time to put some real work in. Korolev would send down its own teams to retrieve resources, but the planet's status as "Extremely Hazardous to Life" makes that slightly illegal.

Plus, what kind of person would be crazy enough to go down there, anyway?

Main-KOR-Questline-BuildLaserDrill.name: Heavy Construction
Main-KOR-Questline-BuildLaserDrill.description:
Time to build a machine capable of safely (well, relatively) extracting and processing Letium from the surface. Fortunately Korolev used to operate Mobile Mining Platforms, giant laser drills that would float through the peaceful skies of Fortuna III in search of mineral veins to exploit.

The days those things could be safely operated are long gone, but they're just the thing we need now to mine for Letium, with some assistance on the ground.

Main-ICA-Questline-TestRun.description:
It's finally time to put everything together and drill for oil! If the ICA can get enough concentrated NiC back onto Prospect Station, they'll be able to keep everything powered on their own, free from the exploitative prices Korolev charges.

A lot is riding on this, Prospector.
Main-ICA-Questline-TestRun.name: Put to the Test

Main-KOR-Questline-Trust.description:
Korolev Heavy Industries, the system's industrial powerhouse... and near monopoly. The megacorp came to Fortuna III early to exploit its resources, and sticks around now to make sure its claims don't lapse. Plus, they keep the lights on up here, for a nice profit.

They want you to perform some simple tasks to prove your mettle. Don't disappoint!
Main-KOR-Questline-Trust.name: Time to Punch In

Main-KOR-Questline-EarlyMap2.description: Korolev found out that Crescent Falls, a once crucial Base of Operations for their Mining Parties, might have just finally been clearing up from all that Radiation again. You should head down there and see what's left. But make sure to gear up.
Main-KOR-Questline-EarlyMap2.name: Uncharted Territory

Main-Osiris-Questline-CaveRumors.name: Lost Knowledge
Main-Osiris-Questline-CaveRumors.description:
Now Dr. Sullivan's interest is piqued after you helped uncover forgotten research into the planet's extinct creatures and their unnatural anatomy. 

It seems he's realizing that the planet's mysteries won't unravel themselves without some hands-on "research" from prospectors like you.

Main-ICA-Questline-OilSearch.name: Never Give Up
Main-ICA-Questline-OilSearch.description:
Things didn't work out with the prototype power generator, but at least it didn't blow up.

The research you gathered hinted at another project, so there's still some hope the ICA can find alternative power source and get out from under Korolev's thumb.

Main-Osiris-Questline-SatelliteRepairs.name: Orbital Repairs
Main-Osiris-Questline-SatelliteRepairs.description:
Warm up tests on the Orbital Cannon have uncovered a serious accuracy issue that needs to be resolved ASAP. The problem is, the satellite is already in orbit, and recalling it would raise questions about its true purpose.

You'll need to help Osiris develop a hotfix.

Main-Osiris-Questline-StrongStims.description:
Osiris specialize in medical tech, from surgical robots to powerful medicines and even healing nanites. Many of their advancements are only possible thanks to prospectors like you retrieving samples from the planet.

Get Osiris what they need, and you'll be rewarded with access to new, stronger health stims.
Main-Osiris-Questline-StrongStims.name: Stimulating Developments

Main-Osiris-Questline-StrongMedkits.name: Path to Strong Medkits
Main-Osiris-Questline-StrongMedkits.description:
The advancements in medical technology continue, partly thanks the samples you've collected.

Now, while emergency medical procedures aren't something you should be practicing on the surface of an alien planet, assisting Osiris in developing improved med kits may improve the chances of a good outcome when you're forced to.

Main-ICA-Questline-Sidework1.name: Private Business
Main-ICA-Questline-Sidework1.description: Some more private work has come up, and you're the right Prospector for the job.

Main-ICA-Questline-MeteorReactor.name: Project Fireball
Main-ICA-Questline-MeteorReactor.description:
Prospect Station's power woes may soon be over. You just need to retrieve some very delicate machinery, get some highly radioactive meteor fragments, and help the ICA build a highly experimental power generator.

A prospector's life is definitely never boring.

Main-ICA-Questline-Caverns.name: Race to the Bottom
Main-ICA-Questline-Caverns.description:
The ICA has been monitoring a decrease in radiation levels over a small island for some time now, and now they want you to go down there and figure what happened to a group of missing colonists.

Not much is known about the island or why the corps set up shop there, but Marie hopes you'll find clues as to what happened to the colonists at the Korolev and Osiris installations. 

And while you're there, maybe you could look into why the corps were so interested in the island's caverns in the first place...

Main-ICA-Questline-Sidework3.name: The Community Needs You
Main-ICA-Questline-Sidework3.description: You're starting to really make a name for yourself in the community, Prospector. They're beginning to trust you more and, with that, ask for your help more.

Main-ICA-Questline-GasGrenades.description:
The ICA are developing a new grenade type, equipped with lethal toxic gasses.

Help them get what they need, those things would be great for area denial... or getting rid of anyone holed up in a fortified position.
Main-ICA-Questline-GasGrenades.name: Toxic Love

Main-ICA-Questline-CommunityWork.description:
The ICA often receives job commissions and requests for prospectors to carry out, acting as a sort of middleman to access the planet.

Handling these jobs keeps the the ICA happy, and they pay well enough, too.
Main-ICA-Questline-CommunityWork.name: Working for the Community

Main-ICA-Questline-Trust.description:
The Independent Civilian Advisory are all about keeping Prospect Station afloat and everyone in it alive.

Will you step up and help? A talented prospector could benefit from being on their good side...
Main-ICA-Questline-Trust.name: Your Civic Duty

Main-KOR-Questline-TestRun.name: The Test Run
Main-KOR-Questline-TestRun.description:
With the Laser Drill complete, it's up to you to test it out and finally retrieve some Letium for Korolev.

Remember to be careful, that thing will draw a lot of unwanted attention during descent, and it'll take a while to produce results!

Main-KOR-Questline-SideWork1.description: Those science people may be busy trying to understand what it is they just discovered, but there's always more work a resourceful prospector like you can do to keep Korolov on top.
Main-KOR-Questline-SideWork1.name: Time for More Work?

Main-KOR-Questline-MiningTool.description:
Tired of swinging that pickaxe yet? Want a new mining tool that'll turn those rocks to dust in just a few short seconds?

Korolev's got you covered, if you complete these simple tasks for them.
Main-KOR-Questline-MiningTool.name: What a Tool!

Main-ICA-Questline-Sidework2.name: Varied Work
Main-ICA-Questline-Sidework2.description: You've done well, and now Marie has some work she only trusts you with.

Main-KOR-Questline-Veltecite.name: Veltecite for the Masses
Main-KOR-Questline-Veltecite.description:
Veltecite fuels Prospect Station's power generators, foundries, engines, and is its main export. The few mineral deposits exposed to the surface can generally be found near water, but tracking one down can be time consuming, and dangerous.

Wouldn't it be nice to have an easier and faster way to get to it? Fortunately Korolev has a few techs working on just the thing.

Objectives.Acquire-CrusherTongues: Defeat Crushers and deliver their Tongues
Objectives.Kill-Players-Advocate: Eliminate Players using the Advocate Assault Rifle
Objectives.Kill-Players-CentralBaseCamp: Eliminate Prospectors at the Central Base Camp on Bright Sands
Objectives.Kill-Players-Lake: Eliminate Prospectors at the Lake on Bright Sands
Objectives.Kill-Players-VaccineLabs: Eliminate Prospectors at the Vaccine Labs on Bright Sands
Objectives.Kill-Players-WaterfallLab: Eliminate Prospectors at the Waterfall Lab on Bright Sands
Objectives.Kill-Players-Jungle: Eliminate Prospectors in the Jungle on Bright Sands
Objectives.Kill-Players-KorolevWeapon: Eliminate Prospectors using a Korolev Weapon

Codex_Prospecting.description:
<BH2>Guns</>! You'll want to carry at least one while on the surface, because you can bet everyone else will be too. Plus there's the matter of all the alien monsters that want to make you their newest chew toy.

It's not all about rate for fire and accuracy; pay special attention to the <BH2>Penetration</> value; the higher, the more damage you'll do to Shielded prospectors and creatures with thick hides.

Want a personal touch? Most weapons can have <BH2>Mods</> attached to improve their performance or change their behaviour in just the right way.

Oh, and don't forget to take some <BH2>Ammo</> with you!

Codex_Aurum.description:
<BH2>Aurum</> is The Cycle: Frontier's premium currency, and is mostly used for purchasing cosmetics, access to <BH2>Premium Fortuna Pass</> rewards, and <BH2>Gear Salvage Insurance</>.

While <BH2>Aurum</> can be purchased in the <BH2>Shop</> for real currency, you can also gain a steady stream of <BH2>Aurum</> by upgrading your Quarter's <BH2>Aurum Generator</>, and by unlocking free rewards in the <BH2>Fortuna Pass</>.

<BH2>Aurum will be retained on your account during Season Wipes.</>

Codex_Prospecting_Consumables.description:
<BH2>Stims</> and <BH2>Medkits</> will keep you alive on the planet; use Stims for a quick health boost, and reserve the Medkits for when you've got enough time to use them.

<BH2>Grenades</> don't just come in the big boom variety; an <BH2>Audio Decoy</> or <BH2>Smoke Grenade</> might hide your escape or aid in an ambush, while a <BH2>Gas Grenade</> will turn any area into a serious safety hazard.

Codex_Seasons.description:
<BH2>The Cycle: Frontier</> plays out during months longs seasons, during which prospectors drop to the surface of <BH2>Fortuna III</> to complete tasks for various <BH2>Factions</>, fight each other for resources, and achieve fame on the hostile planet.

Once a season is over, every prospector's <BH2>Stash, K-Marks balance, Insurance Tokens, Quarter Upgrades</>, and Faction progress are <BH2>reset</> to start fresh in the next season. <BH2>Aurum and all owned Vanity are kept</>, and any <BH2>purchased Bundles are regranted</> and available in the <BH2>Delivery Station</>.

The time remaining in a season, counting down to the wipe, can be seen while in the Station and in the Fortuna Pass menu.

Codex_VanityShop_Weapon.description:
<BH2>Weapons</> can be customized with <BH2>Skins</>, <BH2>Coatings</>, and <BH2>Charms</>.

<BH2>Skins</> are unique and tailored to specific weapons, while <BH2>Coatings</>, as well as <BH2>Charms</>, can be applied to any weapon you own.

Once you own any of these vanity types, <BH2>you can apply them to any compatible weapon in your inventory</>. If you lose a customized weapon on the surface, you'll still have access to the cosmetics for any other weapon.

Looting a weapon with cosmetics you don't own will not unlock them for you, so take care not to replace or lose something unique if you like how it looks!

Codex_VanityShop_Archetypes.description: A <BH2>Prospector</> is a character archetype that allows customizing various unique looks at once, on per <BH2>Prospector</>. Each one has a unique head, and many also have unique body types and suits. Choose the one you think looks best and customize them further as you wish!

Codex_Fortuna_Creatures.description:
Before the Cycle, Fortuna III's ecosystem featured few predators, and none considered dangerous to a well-prepared colonist. The Teratomorphic Energy Field changed all that, with monstruous creatures emerging from the unknown to savage the panicked colonists as they fled the planet's surface. 

Once prospectors began braving the first windows in the Cycle a decade later, they found Fortuna III overrun with large and <BH2>highly hostile beasts</> of unnatural design. Some believe these creatures were always there, hiding under the surface; others see them as the result of constant mutations spurred by the TEF. In either case it's clear that the Cycle is to blame for their appearance, and <BH2>the Storms</> that affect the planet make these creatures even more dangerous.

Codex_VanityShop.description:
Cosmetic items help you stand apart from the competition and define how you want to look on Fortuna III, but don't have any gameplay effects.

There are various types, and <BH2>any Cosmetics you unlock or purchase are tied to your account and won't be lost on the surface or during Season Wipes.</>

Codex_Factions_MissionsJobs.description:
Each faction, will offer you a series of <BH2>Missions</> that further their goals on Fortuna III; completing these won't just reward you with K-Marks and a reputation boost, but often useful kit, and more.

<BH2>Jobs</> are often more simpler tasks, the bread and butter for prospectors, getting each faction what it needs to keep itself in operation. Access to these is gated by your reputation with the faction, with the higher tier Jobs also increasing in difficulty... and rewards.

Codex_FortunaPass.description:
Each season a new <BH2>Fortuna Pass</> will become available, offering the chance to unlock free rewards for completing a number of gameplay actions, from killing hostile creatures, evaccing off the surface, or completing <BH2>Jobs</> for the <BH2>Factions</>.

You'll also be able to purchase access to Premium rewards, offering unique seasonal cosmetic items, by purchasing the <BH2>Premium Pass</> with <BH2>Aurum</>.

And if you're in a rush, you can put in some <BH2>Aurum</> to skip a level and immediately unlock a reward!

Codex_Prospecting_Tools.description:
Every prospector needs some basic tools to get the job done.

Your <BH2>Scanner</> will highlight valuable minerals in the area. You'll want to upgrade it with mods to find more valuable stuff.

The <BH2>Pickaxe</> is what you'll use to pry those minerals out. Tired of swinging it around? Then get yourself a <BH2>Mining Tool</> for faster extraction.

Visibility might be an issue on the surface. You've got a standard <BH2>Flashlight</> for when it's dark, and a pair of basic <BH2>Binoculars</> to survey an area from afar.

Codex_Fortuna.description:
First settled in 2309, Fortuna III was on course to be one of the most prosperous worlds under humanity's domain, before what's known as <BH2>'The Cycle'</> upended everything half a century later, destroying the Progenitor-built Waygate orbiting the moon and cutting the Fortuna system from the rest of humanity.

As a Habitable 'Class 5' planet, Fortuna III had been terraformed tens of thousands of years by a lost civilization referred to as the Progenitors, with an ecosystem practically identical to that of other H-C5 planets, and a similar abundance of the energy-rich <BH2>Veltecite</> that fuels the Waygates connecting them. Why the Progenitors seeded these planets and then vanished isn't yet known, as the only tangible evidence of their existence are the Waygates and inert monuments that dot each planet's surface.

The planet's surface now lies practically abandoned, with only <BH2>Prospectors</> and other fools braving <BH2>The Cycle</>, and the planet's hostile fauna, to secure resources for the station in orbit.

Codex_Factions_Osiris.description:
Formed from the remnants of several research shops and filled with academics, <BH2>Osiris</> was left rudderless after the Cycle cut off effective communications with their parent company. While their goal of researching Progenitor artefacts and reverse engineering their technology remains the same, without access to the surface itself their work was limited to just idle theorizing.

Thankfully the corporation's newest head recognized the value prospectors could offer and is more than happy to send them off to danger for a pittance, so long as they remain effective.

Codex_Prospecting_Armor.description:
If you want to keep your insides inside, then you'll want to equip a <BH2>Shield</> vest and a <BH2>Helmet</>. The higher the <BH2>Armor</> value, the more damage it will absorb from each hit, while a higher <BH2>Durability</> keeps it, and you, intact for longer.

Don't forget to <BH2>Repair</> your damaged equipment at the <BH2>Gear Printer</>!

Codex_Quarters_Upgrades.description: If you've got the right materials in your <BH2>Stash</>, you'll be able to <BH2>upgrade</> your Quarters to help you out in your journey to become the station's best, or richest, prospector. Increase you Stash size, passively earn Aurum and K-Marks, even improve your safe pockets' carrying space; it's worth it.

Codex_Factions_ICA.description:
Initially meant to be only a temporary planetary civilian body to direct the colonization efforts, the <BH2>ICA</> on <BH2>Prospect Station</> came to be the de facto government for the Fortuna system after the Cycle forced the planet's evacuation. Currently its goal is just to keep the station alive and its community healthy, acting as an interface between Habitat, the official station owners, and the various <BH2>factions</> of the station, including the Prospectors that help retrieve vital resources.

The Advisory committee is made up of former colonists, station oligarchs, business representatives, and union leaders, each with their own conflicting interests, often leading to the organization having no clear goals other than the general wellbeing of the station's populace and maintaining a somewhat peaceful status quo.

Codex_Fortuna_Map3.description: Little is known about this island, only recently available to explore after a new window in the Cycle opened up.

Codex_Fortuna_Map2.description:
Located next to <BH2>Bright Sands</>, the large fallen Progenitor ruin at its center gave the area its name. Originally meant to support the construction and eventual operation of the nearby Archimedes science campus, the warm natural pools and rich fertile soil attracted enough interest and business to form the beginnings of a small community of its own.

Even experienced prospectors should be cautious here, as some of the fiercest creatures have make their nests in the abandoned shipping ports and overgrown facilities.

Codex_VanityShop_Character&Melee.description:
Most <BH2>Prospectors</> can swap around different sets of <BH2>Boots</>, <BH2>Gloves</>, and a <BH2>Chest piece</> assuming you own the kit. Some also come with unique <BH2>Full Suits</>, a type of suit that doesn't allow further customization, but is unique to that <BH2>Prospector</>.

<BH2>Melee weapons</> can also be swapped around for each Prospector to give them a unique feel. Just note that these don't behave differently than the standard knife!

Codex_Fortuna_Map1.description:
Once known for its beautiful beaches, thirty years of the Cycle have made Bright Sands more resemble a marsh-filled jungle than what the old postcards depict. The area was to be the location for the Archimedes science campus, an Osiris installation focused on researching Progenitor artifacts in the region; the project was never completed, and the area now lies littered with old infrastructure and temporary support facilities.

As the first window in the Cycle to be discovered almost two decades ago, it's well mapped out and considered one of the best starting points for new prospectors to explore.

Codex_Factions_Korolev.description:
One of the oldest interstellar corporations, and once at the forefront of space exploration, Korolev jumped at the opportunity to set up shop a new <BH2>Veltecite-rich</> colony lost in the fringes of the galaxy.

Now that the Cycle has dashed any hopes profiting off the planet, the remaining <BH2>Korolev</> detachment supports Prospect Station with its industrial prowess, and hopes to lay claim to every bit of ore on the planet once the surface becomes safe to exploit. Assuming that ever happens, at least.

Codex_Station.description:
Orbiting Fortuna III, Habitat's station was never meant to house even a tenth of its current population, numbering in the hundreds of thousands. Built to be a holding area for the rich and powerful, and the system-wide HQ for several megacorps, the station became home to most of the colonists fleeing the surface, with entire freighters and other ships grafted on to it to make space for the new population.

Renamed to <BH2>"Prospect Station"</> once prospectors started dropping to the planet to bring back valuable resources, the station now serves as the hub for a system now cut off from the rest of humanity by a measure of years.

Codex_Station_QuickShop.description: Run by a former ICA boss, the <BH2>Quick Shop</> provides prospectors with <BH2>basic gear</> to keep them going. Cheap CoTEC guns, ammo, basic bags... nothing fancy, but it all works.

Codex_Quarters_Deliveries.description: The Delivery Station doesn't just house your <BH2>Generators</>, of course. Had an 'accident' on the surface? Well if you took out <BH2>Insurance</>, here's where you'll find your payout. Have a special delivery from a Bundle purchased a previous season? It'll be waiting for you here. Look around, and don't forget to empty your Generators before they get too full!

Codex_Quarters_Generators.description: The Generators will earn you a steady stream of <BH2>K-Marks</> and <BH2>Aurum</>, as well as a crate of useful stuff delivered straight to your quarters every day. Just remember to <BH2>check them regularly</> and invest in <BH2>upgrades</> to improve them!

Codex_Station_LaunchingTutorial.description:
The Launch Terminal overlooking Fortuna III will get you in your pod and off to whichever death trap you chose to drop to. Just don't forget to tidy your bag and check your gear before you head out!

You'll also be able to go through the <BH2>Tutorial Simulation</> again if you need a refresher, or just want to enjoy Fortuna III from the safety of orbit.

Codex_Fortuna_Cycle.description:
The Teratomorphic Energy Field, more commonly known as <BH2>"The Cycle"</>, is a hazardous radiation effect that encompasses the entire planet of Fortuna III, though there exist 'windows' that allow for humans, and their technology, to operate without suffering the worst effects.

Initially only causing delicate equipment to malfunction, each wave, found to be following a predictable cadence, increased in intensity until basic machinery failed entirely and colonists left unconscious for the duration. Less than a month after <BH2>the colonies were evacuated</> the energy field settled over the entire world, with its ebb and flow causing <BH2>terrible storms</> over the areas not fully covered by The Cycle.

Codex_Prospecting_Insurance.description:
The surface is a dangerous place to be, and many prospectors don't make it back on their own two feet. Your suit's stasis foam will protect you and your safe pockets, but your gear, bag, and anything in it won't be coming back to the station with you.

That's where insuring your items can help. <BH2>Standard Insurance</> won't get you your items back, but buying it will insure you get some <BH2>K-Marks</> to offset the pain.

<BH2>Gear Salvage</> will cost you <BH2>Aurum</>, or an <BH2>Insurance Token</>, but a bot wil be sent down to hunt for your missing gear. So long as nobody's looted it and evacced off the planet, you'll get it back in some time. And if someone did, you'll still get a <BH2>K-Mark</> compensation payout.

Remember to check your <BH2>Delivery Station</> in your <BH2>Quarters</> for payout; there's a limit to how many can be held for you.

Codex_Station_CraftingRepairing.description:
Want <BH2>better gear</>? Then check out the printing station! If you've got the right materials and enough K-Marks, the Gear Printer can handle the hard parts.

The Gear Printer is also where you'll want to go to <BH2>repair</> any damaged gear; better to reuse what you've got than buy new each time, right?

Codex_Factions.description:
While at its peak Fortuna III was home to dozens of massive corporations, only two remain with an active interest in the surface itself, <BH2>Korolev</> and <BH2>Osiris</>. The <BH2>ICA</>, for its part, is the civilian organization that's tasked itself with keeping Prospect Station safely in orbit and all its people alive.

If you want to get anywhere as a prospector, you'll have to <BH2>work for them</>; it's not just money they'll reward you with, but access to better and better gear, and that really makes the difference on the surface.

Codex_Prospecting_Bags.description:
While your <BH2>Safety Pockets</> may be able to carry a bit of loot around, a prospector is nothing without their trusty Bag.

The better the bag, the more weight it can carry. Be careful to not just fill it up without thinking, though, it'll get heavy, and you never know when you might need to rummage around there in an emergency.

Codex_VanityShop_Other.description: You can further personalize your <BH2>Prospector</> with <BH2>Sprays</> and <BH2>Banners</> to decorate Fortuna III, and <BH2>Emotes</> to show off to others what you're really thinking.

Codex_Quarters.description: You own quarters. It might not seem like much, but it's a palace compared to where most of the station populace resides. Just one of the perks of being a prospector.

DialogContainer_ExitGame.description: Are you sure you want to exit the game?

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key02.description: A Key to the Korolev Quarry's Boss Office. Usually something good stashed away in such places.
Equip_Keys_Map03_Key02.name: Korolev Quarry Building Key

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key03.description: A Key to the Korolev Surgery Room. There must have been a lot of injuries on the island for Korolev to set one up.
Equip_Keys_Map03_Key03.name: Korolev Medical Building Key

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key06.description: A bright white keycard with the telltale livery of Osiris. "Pinnacle Labs" is laser etched professionally onto it.
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key06.name: Lab Keycard

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key03.description: A generic keycard, someone drew a house on stilts on the back.
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key03.name: Tall House Key

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key02.description: A janitor's key loop with a single simple key with a cute broom charm attached; it appears to longingly sweep at the floor as it dangles from your hand
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key02.name: Janitor's Key

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key07.description: A key to The Tipsy Drone attached to a miniature trinket of the namesakes affable drone mascot.
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key07.name: Bar Storage Key

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key01.description: A key to the Osiris Office. Its owner sure won't be missing it...
Equip_Keys_Map03_Key01.name: Research Center Office Key

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key08.description: A key to what was once a more public space
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key08.name: Community Room Key

Equip_Bag03.description: A large backpack for storing items.
Equip_Bag03.name: Large Backpack

Equip_Bag02.description: A medium backpack for storing items.
Equip_Bag02.name: Medium Backpack

Bag_Altered_03.description: A monstrously large backpack for storing items. Its fabric has little in common with the human materials it was once made of.
Bag_Altered_03.name: Monstrous Forged Backpack

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key09.description: A round green logo is barely visible under the muck that's grown over this keycard.
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key09.name: Overgrown Keycard

Equip_Bag01.description: A small backpack for storing items.
Equip_Bag01.name: Small Backpack

Equip_ScrappyBag.description: A worn out backpack that doesn't seem to hold much.
Equip_ScrappyBag.name: Worn Emergency Bag

Helmet_Restoration_01.description: Advanced helmet that includes medical tech capable of reconstructing lost tissue over time.
Helmet_Restoration_01.name: Restoration Helmet

Helmet_Restoration_02.description: Advanced helmet that includes medical tech capable of reconstructing lost tissue over time.
Helmet_Restoration_02.name: Restoration Helmet

Shield_Restoration_01.description: Advanced protective shield that includes medical tech capable of reconstructing lost tissue over time.
Shield_Restoration_01.name: Restoration Shield

Shield_Restoration_02.description: Advanced protective shield that includes medical tech capable of reconstructing lost tissue over time.
Shield_Restoration_02.name: Restoration Shield

Equip_Bag05.description: An astonishingly large backpack for storing items.
Equip_Bag05.name: Gigantic Backpack

Bag_Altered_02.description: An astonishingly large backpack for storing items. This particular piece of gear was somehow altered with Progenitor tech.
Bag_Altered_02.name: Gigantic Forged Backpack

Equip_Bag04.description: An extra large backpack for storing items.
Equip_Bag04.name: Heavy Duty Backpack

Bag_Altered_01.description: An extra large backpack for storing items. This particular piece of gear was somehow altered with Progenitor tech.
Bag_Altered_01.name: Huge Forged Backpack

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key02.description: Appears to be for one of the mine entrances along the northern edge of Bright Sands.
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key02.name: Mine Access Key

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key06.name: Armory Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key06.description: The original label is almost unreadable but you can still identify the word "Jungle" at the top.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key01.name: Boss' Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key01.description: The unmistakable "STARPORT" logo leaps out from the card. The smaller "Top Floor Admin" whispers for your attention in pitiful subscript underneath.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key04.name: Bright Sands Observation Room Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key04.description: Keycard carrying the "Asclepius Vaccines" logo. And several biohazard warnings... may want to wash your hands.

Helmet_Altered.name: Forged Helmet
Helmet_Altered.description: Protects the head of its wearer. This particular piece of gear was somehow altered with Progenitor tech.

Shield_Altered.name: Forged Shield
Shield_Altered.description: Protects the body of its wearer. This particular piece of gear was somehow altered with Progenitor tech.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key03.name: Garage Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key03.description: The keycard has an image of one of those rad looking 6-wheeler trucks printed on it with the text "Garage Office" alongside it.

Helmet_01.name: Helmet
Helmet_01.description: Protects the head of its wearer.

Helmet_02.name: Helmet
Helmet_02.description: Protects the head of its wearer.

Helmet_05.description: Protects the head of its wearer.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key04.description: Labeled with "Nutrion Farms" and is emblazoned the Nutrion Farms logo. It's still covered in a sickly stale pumpkin juice... ew.
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key04.name: Overseer's Office Key

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key05.description: Looks like the key to someone's house. The amount of rust and moss on it seems to imply its origin is somewhere deep in a jungle.
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key05.name: Loose House Key

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key07.name: Luggage Saferoom Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key07.description: The key looks like it is for somewhere in the Base Camp in Bright sands.

Helmet_NV_01.description: Military grade helmet that includes vision enhancement tech.
Helmet_NV_01.name: NV Helmet

Shield_Tactical_01.description: Protects the body of its wearer, and increases their stamina.
Shield_Tactical_01.name: Tactical Shield

Settings_RestoreDefaults.description: Are you sure you want to restore all settings to default?

EULA_Short.description:
By continuing you agree to the EULA and you understand and acknowledge that your data will be processed in accordance with the Privacy Policy.

Please take a few minutes to review our latest End User Licence Agreement and Privacy Policy.

EventPopup_Zeal_2020_Separated_3.description: Finish Event Challenges to get Zeal Charms!

EventPopup_Zeal_2020_Separated_2.description: Grab one of 7 Zeal Crystals each with unique gameplay effects!

EventPopup_Halloween_2020_Separated_3.description: Grab your own Pumpkin Head and collect cauldrons to unlock exclusive rewards!

Event_Season1Wipe_AlienMeteor.description:
It may have rained down from the sky like other moon fragments, this chunk of rock is unlike anything found before.

There's a rythmic hissing if you listen closely, though instruments don't pick up any sounds...
Event_Season1Wipe_AlienMeteor.name: Strange Meteor Core

EventPopup_Zeal_2020_Separated_1.description: Play the time-limited Zeal Event mode!

EventPopup_Zeal_2020.description: Play the time-limited Zeal Event mode, and grab one of 7 Zeal Crystals each with unique gameplay effects.

Faction_FactionScreen_ICA.name: ICA
Faction_FactionScreen_ICA.description: The Independent Civilian Advisory is the government where there is no government. Its mission is to represent workers and the supporting populace on colonies and stations; further the financial and political interests is just a nice bonus. ICA kit is well rounded, effective for most every situation.

Faction_FactionScreen_Korolev.name: KOROLEV
Faction_FactionScreen_Korolev.description: Korolev Heavy Industries is the largest megacorp in frontier space, with a presence in every market if not an outright monopoly on most. Their kit is brutal: no bells and whistles, it works, hits hard, and takes a beating.

Faction_FactionScreen_Osiris.name: OSIRIS
Faction_FactionScreen_Osiris.description: Osiris was built up from the remains of failed and financially unviable R&D firms to perform dangerous and questionable work outside the Artery, where its owner operates under higher legal scrutiny. Osiris kit is cutting edge, geared towards speed and precision.

Gadgets_LostProspectorTranslocator.description: A custom Recall Teleporter, will teleport the user to preset locations under certain conditions.
Gadgets_LostProspectorTranslocator.name: Lost Prospector's Recall Teleporter
Gadgets_LostProspectorTranslocator.lore: Modified based on the schematics from Hector, the Lost Prospector. A lot of effort was put into making this device work and take the user to a predefined location.

Gadgets_Scanner.description: A simple directional scanner, this device will point out items of interest in the direction it's facing, as well as give a rough estimate on their range. Of note is that it can detect other hostile Prospectors in the area.
Gadgets_Scanner.name: Directional Scanner
Gadgets_Scanner.lore: The fluctuating energy fields that affect H-C5.09 make most commonly used scanners ineffective, necessitating this specialized version that, while not as accurate as would be desired, does still work.

Gadgets_Translocator.description: Allows the user to set a recall location to which they can teleport to on demand. Useful for those wanting to get out of a difficult situation.
Gadgets_Translocator.lore: Designed to allow for rapid transport of goods in large factories, the Recall Teleporter has been largely deemed unsafe for use with biological matter, due to minuscule but cumulative errors in the copy and recreation process. Of course, Prospectors aren't exactly known for being risk adverse.
Gadgets_Translocator.name: Recall Teleporter

Gadgets_HealBeam.description: Fires a beam that can heal allied prospectors and fix friendly mechanical devices. The charge cannister can also be used to heal the operator when injured.
Gadgets_HealBeam.name: Kheper Revitalizer
Gadgets_HealBeam.lore: The Kheper Revitalizer uses a linked-light beam to energize and guide a swarm of nanites to a target; once in proximity these quickly adapt to repair any damage before becoming inert, either becoming part of the repaired structure or turning to dust.

Generic_Vehicle.description: A simple off-road gravbike capable of quickly carrying a prospector across the surface of Fortuna III.

Generic_ShutdownTitle.description: Game is about to shut down. Please evacuate the planet in {RemainingTime} or all items will be lost

Lobby_PreLobby_FactionList.description: SELECT THE FACTION YOU WANT TO SUPPORT IN THIS MATCH TO EARN THEIR FAVOR!

Login_Banned.description: If you would like to challenge this ban, please contact our Player Support.

AF_Slag.name: Progenitor Slag
AF_Slag.description: Refuse from some unknown process. Not very useful, but still fetches a high price on the station by alien artefact collectors and admirers of rare art.

AF_Token.description:
A sphere of processed and activated Tharis Iron impossibly locked in place. 

Gives an aura of infinite potential.
AF_Token.name: Abyss Alloy

Adhesive.description:
Multi purpose tool, handy for sticking things together or providing flexible insulation.

The warning label says to not use if you need a warning label.
Adhesive.name: Resin Gun

Alien Fruit.name: Indigenous Fruit
Alien Fruit.description: Tastes delicious, and can be processed to gain some useful chemicals.

AlienPlant.description: A unique plant so far only found on Tharis Island. Nothing about it feels right...
AlienPlant.name: Spine Briar

AlienScrap.description: A clearly alien material, the Progenitors built their monuments on Fortuna III with this. Could possibly be used to build other things, as well.
AlienScrap.name: Progenitor Composite

Alloys.description: A collection of metal alloys used as a base material in many items, ready to slot into compatible printers.
Alloys.name: Metallic Alloys

AlphaCrusherSkull.name: Alpha Crusher Skull
AlphaCrusherSkull.description: It doesn't seem to have any real practical purpose, but this trophy is one of the most desired items Fortuna III produces.

AlphaWardenHeart.name: Alpha Crusher Heart
AlphaWardenHeart.description: The heart of an Alpha Crusher, or at least chunks of it, can be used for several almost miraculous medical treatments. It's also a local delicacy, for those with more money than sense.

AluminumParts.name: Aluminum scrap
AluminumParts.description: Mostly aluminum and steel; not the most valuable salvage, but useful for printing.

AnaestheticsContainers.description:
A small crate of miscellaneous medical supplies, has all sorts of chemicals useful for printing new items.

There are A LOT of warning labels here.
AnaestheticsContainers.name: Medical Supplies

Antibiotics.description:
Medicine left behind on the planet, can be processed to make new supplies.

Fortuna's colonists definitely had a lot of pills...
Antibiotics.name: Old Medicine

ArdorShard.name: Cloudy Veltecite
ArdorShard.description: Shards of Cloudy Veltecite are often used for energy storage and generation. Korolev are always looking for any that prospectors can mine.

AutoLoader.name: Autoloader
AutoLoader.description: Used for printing a variety of equipment requiring regular charges, such as weapons.

AzureTree.name: Azure Tree Bark
AzureTree.description: Azure Trees are found sprinkled around the less shaded areas of Fortuna III, with their bark coveted for artisanal goods.

BallBearings.description: A simple mechanical component used to print a multitude of machines with moving parts, such as firearms.
BallBearings.name: Ball Bearings

Battery.name: "Fusion Cartridge" Batteries
Battery.description:
A pack of high-powered, slightly radioactive batteries. Safe to use in most electronic devices.

Not actually fusion powered, but still worryingly radioactive.

Biomass.description: Fortuna III's hostile creatures are already mutated versions of smaller and less aggressive ancestors, but Cycle Storms push forward rarer latent mutations. Researchers buy this stuff, as do some "fancy" restaurants.
Biomass.name: Mutated Biomass

BlueRunnerEgg.name: Blue Runner Egg
BlueRunnerEgg.description: Blue Runner eggs have a notoriously thick shell, allowing them to only care for the eggs when close to hatching. Can be sold on the station.

Brightcap.name: Brightcap Mushroom
Brightcap.description: Good for selling and desired by Osiris for their rare properties. Also tastes good, if prepared properly.

BrittleTitanOre.name: Brittle Titan Ore
BrittleTitanOre.description: Somewhat common on H-C5 planets, Titan Ore was essential during the initial colonization. Still used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

CPUBlue.description: Made for crunching through large datasets, used in several devices that require large amounts of simple calculations.
CPUBlue.name: Zero Systems CPU

CPURed.description: An advanced CPU, ideal for the running of adaptive AI systems or the manipulation of complex energy fields.
CPURed.name: Master Unit CPU

Cables.description:
A bundle of cables, still in good condition.

Unfortunately not platinum plated, unsuitable for true audio transmission.
Cables.name: Electronic Cables

Cadmium.name: Cadmium
Cadmium.description: Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this material is still worth selling at the station.

ChalniFeather.name: Chalni Feather
ChalniFeather.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

ChargedForgeIronIngot.description:
An ingot made of Pure Tharis Iron somehow charged with storm lightning. Sometimes lets off a shock when touched, and you can hear a buzz if you put it next to your ear.

OSIRIS ADVISORY: Do not any under circumstances interact with this material without Class T protective gear!
ChargedForgeIronIngot.name: Charged Tharis Iron Ingot

Circuit Board.description:
An old circuit board, its components can be salvaged and repurposed to build new items.

And now you can put e-waste management on your resume.
Circuit Board.name: Circuit Board

CommonVeltecite.name: Flawed Veltecite
CommonVeltecite.description: While relatively low in value, flawed veltecite is still valuable enough to be worth taking a pickaxe to some rocks.

CompoundSheets.name: Compound Sheets
CompoundSheets.description: Standardized metal and plastic sheets like these are used to print everything from tractors to weapons, so long as you follow the right printing instructions.

Copper Wire.name: Copper Wire
Copper Wire.description: Still the best bang for the buck for electric cables, makes for a good and cheap electric conductor.

CreatureClaw.description: Hard and sharp, claws like these are capable of piercing a prospector's defenses and rip their flesh apart with ease.
CreatureClaw.name: Sharp Claw

CrusherHead.name: Crusher Head
CrusherHead.description:
The torn off head of a dead Crusher.

It's even uglier up close... Still, a fine trophy!

CrusherMeat.description:
A chunk of Crusher flesh.

Even its meat is hard as bone.
CrusherMeat.name: Crusher Flesh

CrusherSkin.name: Crusher Hide
CrusherSkin.description:
Taken off a skinned Crusher.

(read: hacked repeatedly until something fell off)

CrusherTongue.name: Crusher Tongue
CrusherTongue.description: Tough and slimy, the tongue's secretions have a variety of uses if refined, and the flesh itself is considered a delicacy if prepared correctly.

DataPad.name: Interactive Screen
DataPad.description: Interactive Screens were common among civilians on Fortuna III, used for all sorts of purposes. Cached data and basic components give them some selling value.

DerelictExplosives.name: Derelict Explosives
DerelictExplosives.description: Fortuna III's settlers took to using explosives to both mold the environment to their liking and get rid of the local pests. Can still be sold on the station, for fireworks of course.

DesertPlant.name: Dustbloom
DesertPlant.description: This lonely weed grows in open, arid areas on Fortuna III and develops valuable vibrant blossoms when exposed to direct sunlight.

EpicVeltecite.name: Pure Veltecite
EpicVeltecite.description: Very rare shard of pure Veltecite torn out of a mineral vein, highly valued by Korolev and others.

ExoNeedles.name: Howler Needles
ExoNeedles.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

Fabrics.description:
Heavy and durable fabrics, useful for printing various items.

You can never get the smell of mildew out of these.
Fabrics.name: Textiles

FlakedLethium.name: Letium Clot
FlakedLethium.description: Solidified mass of Letium, rare and valuable.

FocusCrystal.name: Focus Crystal
FocusCrystal.description: Growths of these crystals are common on Fortuna III, valuable on the station for where they're often used in the creation of miniature figures.

ForgeIronIngot.description: A well shaped ingot made with Tharis Iron. Harder and heavier than anything else you have ever felt. Slightly warm to the touch.
ForgeIronIngot.name: Tharis Iron Ingot

ForgeIron.description: A solid clump of inert ancient nanites fused with iron, along with various other elements trapped within when the mass solidified.
ForgeIron.name: Tharis Iron

GenericCreatureDrop.name: Spinal Base
GenericCreatureDrop.description: Wanted for several rare materials easily harvested from the spine, as well as for research by those looking into the origins of Fortuna III's hostile creatures.

GlowingCrystalCoreShard.description: Extracted from a glowing Teratomorphic Crystal, just holding this in your bag gives you an uneasy feeling.
GlowingCrystalCoreShard.name: Teratomorphic Crystal Core

GlowyBrightcap.description: A rare glowy mushroom that can only be harvested during the storm on Fortuna. Highly coveted by Osiris.
GlowyBrightcap.name: Glowy Brightcap Mushroom

GyroScope.name: Gyroscope
GyroScope.description: Helps keep things pointing where they're supposed to be pointing even in the roughest conditions, making it quite useful for printing some weapon components.

HardenedBoneAlloy.description: Dropped from some of Fortuna III's toughest creatures, can be used for printing certain items after refining.
HardenedBoneAlloy.name: Hardened Bone Plates

HydraulicPiston.name: Hydraulic Piston
HydraulicPiston.description: Useful for printing weapons and beacons. The tech may be hundreds of years old, but if it works, it works.

Insulation.description:
Even outside of its intended purpose, the materials still have various uses in item printing.

Yes, it's asbestos.
Insulation.name: Salvaged Insulation

IvyPlant.name: Pale Ivy Blossom
IvyPlant.description: The blossom of Pale Ivy, a strange plant that likes to climb up walls to keep its gorgeous, divinely smelling petals out of the reach of critters and insects.

Jewellery.description:
A simple and easy way to carry one's riches and memories.

Also very easy to lose during an emergency evacuation.
Jewellery.name: Jewellery

LegendaryVeltecite.description: The "heart" of a veltecite vein, from which pure and common veltecite grows out of like roots reaching upwards to the surface. Incredibly rare and highly coveted.
LegendaryVeltecite.name: Veltecite Heart

LiquidFertilizer.name: "Magic-GROW" Fertilizer
LiquidFertilizer.description:
A powerful and sweet smelling chemical, can be processed to help manufacture other items.

Don't ingest within 6 hours of consuming any fruits or nuts. Or ideally ever.

MagStab.description: A component necessary for certain weapons with high power usage.
MagStab.name: Magnetic Field Stabilizer

MagneticOre.name: Magnetite
MagneticOre.description: Properly refined and treated, these ores can be used to create powerful magnets used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

MeteorCore.name: Meteor Core
MeteorCore.description: Rare radioactive crystal, retrieved from debris of Fortuna III's cracked moon. Extremely valuable.

MeteorFragment.name: Meteor Fragment
MeteorFragment.description: Rare radioactive crystal, retrieved from debris of Fortuna III's cracked moon. Highly valuable.

MiniReactor.name: Miniature Reactor
MiniReactor.description:
Useful for printing equipment with high power requirements.
DO NOT DISASSEMBLE. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO REPAIR. IF DAMAGED, DISPOSE OF AS INSTRUCTED IN FIG-24B.

MultiTool.name: Salvaged Co-TEC MultiTool
MultiTool.description: These used to be able print, repair, and manipulate simple machinery and electronics. Might still be useful if repaired or used for parts.

NeuroToxicGlands.description: The foul smelling sack some creatures use to produce compounds capable of breaking down common synthetic materials, nevermind human flesh.
NeuroToxicGlands.name: Toxic Glands

Nickel.description: Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this material is still worth mining.
Nickel.name: Nickel

OilTank.description:
A pressured cannister filled with concentrated Nanite-infused Crude. It reacts to the storm radiation in strange ways.

Almost looks like it's alive, moving and swirling on its own.
OilTank.name: NiC Oil Cannister

OldCurrency.description: Currency used on Fortuna III before the evacuations. Still in use by some on Prospect Station.
OldCurrency.name: Old Currency

OpticGlass.name: Optic Glass
OpticGlass.description: Perfectly polished, lenses like these often find themselves used more in high-powered cutting machinery than in actual optic equipment.

PolariumCrystal.name: Polirium Crystal
PolariumCrystal.description: Rare crystal, is of scientific interest and can be sold for K-Marks.

Polonium.name: Polonium
Polonium.description: Valuable glowy mineral that can only be mined during an active storm on Fortuna III

PolymetallicPrefabricate.description: One of those "miracle materials", sheets of this stuff is commonly used in the printing of various tools, machinery, and of course, weapons.
PolymetallicPrefabricate.name: Polymetallic Prefabricate

PortableLabEquipmentBox.description:
A full lab in a box, also contains all sorts of specialized equipment and materials that can be repurposed.

Loaded with delicate tools, sensitive software, and no manual.
PortableLabEquipmentBox.name: Portable Lab

PowerSource.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.
PowerSource.name: Power Cell

PrintResin.description: Can be loaded into most printers to print the base components of almost anything, from rubber ducks to weapon parts.
PrintResin.name: Print Resin

ProteinBar.description: Nutrion's flagship product, a full day's meal in a single candy bar.
ProteinBar.name: Nutritional Bar

PureFocusCrystal.description: Growths of these crystals are common on Fortuna III, valuable on the station for where they're often used in the creation of miniature figures.
PureFocusCrystal.name: Pure Focus Crystal

PureForgeIron.description: A small mass of inert nanites mixed with elemental iron and few other metals. The composite structure is almost perfect.
PureForgeIron.name: Pure Tharis Iron

PureNickel.name: Altered Nickel
PureNickel.description: Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this ore seems to have been affected by proximity with the rare crystals.

RadioSpareParts.description: An old colonial radio transceiver; salvaging these for item printing is cheaper than buying new parts.
RadioSpareParts.name: Radio Equipment

RareVeltecite.description: A rare shard of clear Veltecite. Korolev will pay a decent bit of pocket money for any that prospectors uncover with their pickaxes.
RareVeltecite.name: Clear Veltecite

RattlerEyes_2.name: Mature Rattler Eyes
RattlerEyes_2.description:
The eyes of a dead Mature Rattler.

Age only improved the thing's sight...

RattlerEyes.name: Rattler Eyes
RattlerEyes.description:
The eyes of a dead Rattler.

Well, hopefully it was dead, anyway...

RattlerHead_02.name: Mature Rattler Head
RattlerHead_02.description:
The torn off head of a dead Mature Rattler.

These things do NOT age gracefully...

RattlerHead.name: Rattler Head
RattlerHead.description:
The torn off head of a dead Rattler.

Corrosive drool everywhere, handle with gloves.

RattlerSkin.name: Rattler Skin
RattlerSkin.description:
Taken off a skinned Rattler.

Fashionable! Just don't think about where it came from.

SampleContainer.description:
A sealed self-powered container for exotic alien samples.

Scientists are always putting little things in jars and hoping for the best.
SampleContainer.name: Sample Container

SamplingDevice.description:
A portable device used for collecting biological samples in the field. Can be used to assist with printing delicate items.

This model incorporates a pressure-activated injector as well. Mildly concerning.
SamplingDevice.name: Biological Sampler

ShardSlicer.description: A delicate yet powerful machine used for printing certain items.
ShardSlicer.name: Shard Slicer

ShockAbsorber.description: A component used for certain weapons with heavy recoil.
ShockAbsorber.name: Shock Absorber

Smart mesh.description:
Adaptable material, used for printing various items.

Also a fun art tool!
Smart mesh.name: Smart Mesh

SpareCasing.name: Hardened Metals
SpareCasing.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

StormSurgeCrystal.description: Malformed veltecite, created when the Cycle emits a localized spike and excites latent veltecite veins underground into growing at an accelerated rate. It's definitely health hazard, but it's also worth a lot...
StormSurgeCrystal.name: Storm Surge Crystal

StormyCreatureDrop.name: Charged Spinal Base
StormyCreatureDrop.description: The base of the spine of a hostile Fortuna III creature affected by the Cycle. Contains some useful materials for various items or research.

StriderHead_03.name: Heavy Strider Head
StriderHead_03.description:
The torn off head of a dead Heavy Strider.

Far too ugly to mount on a wall.

StriderHead.name: Strider Head
StriderHead.description:
The torn off head of a dead Strider.

Careful, it can still bite!

StriderMeat_3.description:
A chunk of flesh from a Heavy Strider.

Tougher than normal Strider meat, it barely bleeds.
StriderMeat_3.name: Heavy Strider Flesh

StriderMeat.description:
A chunk of Strider flesh. Presumably of a dead one.

You know, if you cook it properly it's actually pretty good.
StriderMeat.name: Strider Flesh

SuperChargedForgeIronIngot.description:
An ingot made of Pure Tharis Iron, heavily charged with storm lightning. Just touching it leaves your fingers numb.

OSIRIS ADVISORY: Do not any under circumstances interact with this material without Class T protective gear!
SuperChargedForgeIronIngot.name: Super Charged Tharis Iron Ingot

TitanOre.description: Somewhat common on H-C5 planets, Titan Ore was essential during the initial colonization. Still used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.
TitanOre.name: Titan Ore

VaintarShell.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.
VaintarShell.name: Vaintar Shell

WaterPlant.description: The pollen filament of a Waterweed, a plant that can only be harvested around water bodies such as lakes or swamps on Fortuna III. The blossoms themselves are worthless, but these Filaments fetch a decent price on Prospect Station.
WaterPlant.name: Waterweed Filament

WeremoleHead_02.name: Savage Marauder Head
WeremoleHead_02.description:
The torn off head of a dead Savage Marauder.

It's still blinking. Menacingly.

WeremoleHead.name: Marauder Head
WeremoleHead.description:
The torn off head of a dead Marauder.

The eyes still follow you around. Creepy.

WeremoleMeat_2.description:
A chunk of Savage Marauder flesh.

Burns if you touch it without gloves.
WeremoleMeat_2.name: Savage Marauder Flesh

WeremoleMeat.description:
A chunk of Marauder flesh.

It moves if you poke it.
WeremoleMeat.name: Marauder Flesh

MissionItem_AlienDoorFragment.description:
A loose bit from the strange door in one of the Osiris installations on Tharis Island.

The door itself seems impenetrable, far more robust than what Osiris is known for building.
MissionItem_AlienDoorFragment.name: Osiris Door Fragment

MissionItem_AlienShieldRecipe.description:
An old sheet of paper with various drawings and pictograms laid out as simple formulas, all but one scratched out.

The same trident-like drawing found on previous cultist items features prominently here.
MissionItem_AlienShieldRecipe.name: Cultist Scribblings

MissionItem_AlphaSkull.description: The tooth of a now extinct massive beast once common on Fortuna III. Parts of it seem to have unnatural grooves and geometric shapes.
MissionItem_AlphaSkull.name: Warden Tooth

MissionItem_AnalysisTool.name: Advanced Analysis Toolkit
MissionItem_AnalysisTool.description: An old Osiris portable lab, still in working condition. Surely nobody will mind giving it a new home and purpose...

MissionItem_ColonistItem.description: An old mini-comm and some personal items. Whoever this belonged to likely didn't work on the island.
MissionItem_ColonistItem.name: Colonist Item

MissionItem_CreatureSample.description: A container preserving... something. A label on the side states: "WARNING: HIGH LETIUM CONTENT, DO NOT SHAKE"
MissionItem_CreatureSample.name: Letium Bio Samples

MissionItem_CultistGlowCrystalItem.description:
A crystaline chunk with various cables and circuit boards haphazardly strapped on to it.

It's impossible to tell if the mind that created this had something utilitarian in mind, or if this creation is simply a form of religious "art".
MissionItem_CultistGlowCrystalItem.name: Mysterious Glowing Contraption

MissionItem_CultistRitualItem.name: Cultist Ritual Item
MissionItem_CultistRitualItem.description: Some sort of cultist fetish, featuring a clump of Tharis Iron and a sigil or diagram of some kind. Maybe they venerated the alien material? Or it's just a symbol for the caverns themselves?

MissionItem_EngineerItem.description: An engineer's helmet caked in Letium. The embedded sensors may have recorded something important.
MissionItem_EngineerItem.name: Letium Coated Helmet

MissionItem_FlightRecorder.description: A cargo ship's flight recorder, only slightly damaged. Highly encrypted and beyond your suit's ability to access.
MissionItem_FlightRecorder.name: Flight Recorder

MissionItem_ForgeIronSample.description: A collected sample of a rare composite material found in the Tharis Caverns
MissionItem_ForgeIronSample.name: Tharis Iron Sample

MissionItem_ICAPersonalItem.description: A photo of Marie and a prospector named Tao. Rare to see paper photographs anymore, it must have meant a lot to the owner.
MissionItem_ICAPersonalItem.name: Sign of Life from Stranded Prospector

MissionItem_KorChiefEngineerDiary.description:
An off the record log of some of the events that occurred on Tharis island. While badly damaged, and much of it is in short hand, what's evident is Korolev ran into serious issues in the caverns: several reports of miners going missing, pervasive malaise, multiple accidents...

The operation's foreman clearly had little regard for workplace safety.
MissionItem_KorChiefEngineerDiary.name: Chief Engineer's Personal Diary

MissionItem_KorCivilianItem.description: An ancient video recording device, probably fashionable in some retro circles. Amazingly it actually powered on, though only for a few seconds.
MissionItem_KorCivilianItem.name: Vintage Camera

MissionItem_LaserDrillPart.name: Laser Drill Control Unit
MissionItem_LaserDrillPart.description: Part of the system that manages the Drill. Hopefully it can be reconfigured to safely mine for Letium.

MissionItem_MinerItem1.description: Camera belonging to a "Jamie Faulkner". The last video file is damaged, but the audio is of a large crowd demanding to be let in" before suddenly cutting off."
MissionItem_MinerItem1.name: Miner Cam #2F53

MissionItem_MinerItem2.name: Miner Cam #D027
MissionItem_MinerItem2.description: Owner named only as "Temporary". Last video shows several workers running out barricaded buildings and towards a clearing with a guarded ship being loaded with ore. Video cuts off after the owner appears to trip and fall.

MissionItem_MinerItem3.description: Camera belonging to a "Mayumi S. Nagao". Video shows her being pushed out of a cargo ship by a Korolev Heavy Trooper and falling into the mud. Video cuts off shortly after an eruption of gunfire is heard around her.
MissionItem_MinerItem3.name: Miner Cam #A45D

MissionItem_MiningPartyMedicalFiles.description:
A collection of medical reports from the Korolev team working the caverns. Initial incidents involved exhaustion and minor injuries, but later reports focus on mental clouding, hallucinations, loss of time...

Symptoms appear identical to those of prolonged exposure to the Teratomorphic Energy Field that now envelops most of Fortuna III.
MissionItem_MiningPartyMedicalFiles.name: Mining Party Medical Files

MissionItem_Notebook.description: An Osiris researcher's notebook. It's seen better days. Full of formulas, drawings, and long paragraphs regarding the unnatural evolution and mutations of Fortuna III's fauna caused by Progenitor terraformers.
MissionItem_Notebook.name: Old Notebook

MissionItem_OilPumpPart.name: Oil Pump Part
MissionItem_OilPumpPart.description: One of the few remaining components from an old oil pump that still looks to be in working condition.

MissionItem_OldBones.description: Belonging to a long dead creature, damage has exposed metalic elements that seemed to have formed after death.
MissionItem_OldBones.name: Old Bones

MissionItem_OsiChiefEngineerItem.name: Osiris Engineer Scanner
MissionItem_OsiChiefEngineerItem.description: Recovered off the body of an Osiris engineer in Tharis Caverns, appears to have been mapping out potential research locations when they met with a terrible fate.

MissionItem_OsiHeadScientistItem.description:
A damaged Osiris researcher helmet, these always carry their own camera and data storage.

Fortunately, whatever it was that did short work of its wearer managed to avoid breaking any of the valuable bits.
MissionItem_OsiHeadScientistItem.name: Osiris Helmet Recorder

MissionItem_PowerPlantItem1.name: Notes on Meteor Experiment - 1
MissionItem_PowerPlantItem1.description: Personal data tablet with theoretical research on powering energy generators with fragments from Fortuna's moon. The power output of a single working "Fireball generator would be revolutionary."

MissionItem_PowerPlantItem2.description:
Data on the first prototype for "Project Fireball". Yields under safe conditions were underwhelming, with warnings of an uncontrollable chain reaction if pushed too hard without further research. Might explain why there's a giant hole in the moon...

Final notes suggest switching resources to look into "NiC".
MissionItem_PowerPlantItem2.name: Notes on Meteor Experiment - 2

MissionItem_PureForgeIronNugget.description: A tagged nugget of a rare composite material found in the Tharis Caverns. Denser and with next to no impurities than most samples.
MissionItem_PureForgeIronNugget.name: Pure Tharis Iron Nugget

MissionItem_StolenKorData1.description: A chunky old data drive. Might have some valuable info, if it still works.
MissionItem_StolenKorData1.name: Korolev Data Drive #473-D

MissionItem_StolenKorData2.description: A Korolev data drive. Appears to have been used as a blunt instrument. Has definitely seen better days.
MissionItem_StolenKorData2.name: Korolev Notes

MissionItem_StolenOsiHoloMap.description: A map liberated from an abandoned Osiris outpost. Shows the layout of the Tharis caverns, including several areas marked as high-interest.
MissionItem_StolenOsiHoloMap.name: Tharis Caverns Holo-Map

MissionItem_VadimPredecessorItem.description:
A folder kept by Gregor Kazan, the Head of Operations for Korolev when the storms hit Fortuna III decades ago. It appears he intentionally kept all reports and findings from the Tharis operations off the system, though the reason for that isn't explained, nor is how the folder ended up on the island.

Worryingly, official records state less than 50 Korolev employees ever worked in the caverns, while these files list several hundred.
MissionItem_VadimPredecessorItem.name: The Tharis Files

QuestItem_ICAScrip.name: ICA Scrip
QuestItem_ICAScrip.description: Rewarded by the ICA, required for upgrades to your Quarters' Supply Crate Generator and Gear Printer.

QuestItem_KorolevScrip.name: Korolev Scrip
QuestItem_KorolevScrip.description: Rewarded by Korolev, required for upgrades to your Quarters' Stash and Safe Pockets.

QuestItem_OsirisScrip.name: Osiris Scrip
QuestItem_OsirisScrip.description: Rewarded by Osiris, required for upgrades to your Quarters' K-Mark and Aurum generators.

QuestItem_HardDrive_DigSite.name: "Dig Site" Data Drive
QuestItem_HardDrive_DigSite.description: A data drive carrying information on the Bright Sands Dig Site.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier5.description: A data drive with highly valuable and unique information. Can be exchanged for K-Marks.
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier5.name: Data Drive Tier 5

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier3.description: A data drive with rare information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier3.name: Data Drive Tier 3

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier2.description: A data drive with some interesting information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier2.name: Data Drive Tier 2

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier4.description: A data drive with valuable information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier4.name: Data Drive Tier 4

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier1.description: A data drive. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier1.name: Data Drive Tier 1

WinterMaterial_Event_01.description:
A jolly little spaceman figurine, themed after the suits used by the crew of the Starlight Song as they assisted in the rescue of Aurora Station over the planet Neptune in 2125.

Models like this would often sing short and happy songs, light up, or even dance around.
WinterMaterial_Event_01.name: Singing Spaceman

QuestItem_Battery.description: A letium-based battery that can be used to power various machinery on Fortuna.
QuestItem_Battery.name: Battery

QuestItem_LaserDrillBeacon.description: A powerful locator that can be used to call down a Korolev Laser Drill Platform on Extreme Letium Veins.
QuestItem_LaserDrillBeacon.name: Laser Drill Beacon

QuestItem_OilPumpBeacon.description: A powerful locator that can be used to call down an ICA NiC pump and refiner on an oil deposit.
QuestItem_OilPumpBeacon.name: Oil Pump Beacon

QuestItem_AlphaWardenBait.name: Alpha Crusher Bait
QuestItem_AlphaWardenBait.description: Printed using Mutated Biomass, this bait can be used to summon an Alpha Crusher at one of its Feeding Grounds.

EpicModKit.name: Epic Mod Kit
EpicModKit.description: Epic mod kit description FILL IN.

LegendaryModKit.name: Legendary Mod Kit
LegendaryModKit.description: Legendary mod kit description FILL IN.

QuestItem_OrbitalCannonTarget.name: Orbital Cannon Beacon
QuestItem_OrbitalCannonTarget.description: Used for opening the Elite Crusher Caverns, highly charged Osiris laser gets fired at location of this beacon.

RareModKit.name: Rare Mod Kit
RareModKit.description: Rare mod kit description FILL IN.

UncommonModKit.name: Uncommon Mod Kit
UncommonModKit.description: Uncommon mod kit description FILL IN.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_09.description: Your Delivery Station will also contain any Twitch Drops your entitled to, Welcome Packs purchased in past seasons, and other unique deliveries meant for you.

Mod_Optic_Variable_01.name: 2 - 4x Variable Optic
Mod_Optic_Variable_01.description: Variable optic that allows to swap between 2x and 4x magnification.

Mod_Tactical_Flashlight_01.description: A mounted flashlight that can be toggled on and off.
Mod_Tactical_Flashlight_01.name: Tactical Light

Mods_Perk_HealingAmount.description: Bonus to Stim and Medkit healing

Mod_Korolev_Scanner_Oil.name: Crude Oil Scanning Module
Mod_Korolev_Scanner_Oil.description: Scanners equipped with this Attachment can highlight active Crude Oil Wells while scanning.

Mods_Perk_HunterVisionHelm.description: Enhanced Alien Hunter Vision which consumes stamina (can be toggled on/off)

Mods_Perk_NightVision.description: Enhanced Night Vision (can be toggled on/off)

Mod_RearGrip_01.name: Ergonomic Grip
Mod_RearGrip_01.description: Improves a weapon's time to equip.

Mod_RearGrip_02.name: Ergonomic Grip
Mod_RearGrip_02.description: Improves a weapon's time to equip.

Mod_Converter_Shotgun_Slug_01.description: Fires a single projectile improving the effective range.
Mod_Converter_Shotgun_Slug_01.name: Shotgun Slugs

Mod_Converter_Shotgun_Slug_02.description: Fires a single projectile improving the effective range.
Mod_Converter_Shotgun_Slug_02.name: Shotgun Slugs

Mod_Converter_Shotgun_Slug_03.description: Fires a single projectile improving the effective range.
Mod_Converter_Shotgun_Slug_03.name: Shotgun Slugs

Mod_Korolev_Scanner_AlienCrystals.name: Focus Crystal Scanning Module
Mod_Korolev_Scanner_AlienCrystals.description: Scanners equipped with this Attachment can highlight Focus Crystals and Pure Focus Crystals while scanning.

Mods_Perk_HealthRegen_Storm.description: Health restoration per second during a Storm

Mod_Magazine_Heavy_01.name: Heavy Extended
Mod_Magazine_Heavy_01.description: Increases the capacity of the magazine.

Mod_Magazine_Heavy_02.name: Heavy Extended
Mod_Magazine_Heavy_02.description: Increases the capacity of the magazine.

Mod_Magazine_Heavy_03.name: Heavy Extended
Mod_Magazine_Heavy_03.description: Increases the capacity of the magazine.

Mods_Perk_AIDetection.description: Hostile fauna is less aggressive towards the wearer

Mod_ForeGrip_Equip_01.name: Quickdraw Foregrip

Mods_Perk_AIProtection.description: Less damage from hostile fauna attacks

Mod_Stock_Marksman_ADS_01.name: MKM Tactical Stock
Mod_Stock_Marksman_ADS_01.description: Reduces the time to aim down the sight.

Mod_Stock_Marksman_ADS_02.name: MKM Tactical Stock

Thank you for playing The Cycle! 

If you would like to support the development of the game you can purchase one of our Founder's Packs!

Each Founders Pack immediately unlocks exclusive costumes and weapon skins, and contains in-game currency at a one-time discount. In-game currency can be used later this year in our in-game shop.

This incredible offer is only available for a limited time and will be removed when The Cycle officially launches. 

The purchase of a Founder's Pack happens via the Epic Games Store - clicking on the purchase button will redirect you to our store page.
